Line 48: Line 48:
Since the successful overthrow of the Ben Ali regime, a number of self-immolation protests have taken place in other Arab republics. In [[Algeria]], [[Mohsen bouterfif|Mohsen Bouterfif]] set himself on fire after a meeting with a town mayor failed in helping him find employment and housing on January 13, 2011. He later died of his wounds. Also in Algeria, another man attempted but failed to burn himself.<ref>{{cite web|author=Ian Black Middle East editor |url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/2011/jan/16/tunisia-protests-suicide-algeria-arab |title=Tunisia's protests spark suicide in Algeria and fears through Arab world |publisher=Guardian |date= |accessdate=2011-01-23}}</ref> In [[Egypt]], Abdou Abdel-Moneim Jaafar, a 49-year-old restaurant owner, set himself alight in front of the [[Egyptian Parliament]].<ref name="Abdou Abdel-Moneim Jaafar">{{cite web|url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/1/2/4115/Egypt/Society/In-Egypt,-man-sets-himself-on-fire.aspx |title=In Egypt, man sets himself on fire, driven by economic woes |publisher=English.ahram.org.eg |date=2011-01-17 |accessdate=2011-01-23}}</ref> In [[Saudi Arabia]], an unidentified 65-year man died on January 21, 2011 after setting himself on fire in the town of [[Samtah]], [[Jizan]]. This was apparently the kingdom's first known case of self-immolation.<ref name="saudi">{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-12260465|title=Man dies after setting himself on fire in Saudi Arabia|author=|date=23 January 2011 |work=|publisher=BBC News, http://www.bbc.co.uk/|accessdate=23 January 2011 }}</ref><ref name="saudi2">{{cite web|url=http://sundaytimes.lk/world-news/4231-man-dies-in-possible-first-self-immolation-in-saudi|title=Man dies in possible first self-immolation in Saudi |author=Mohideen Mifthah |date=22 January 2011 |work=|publisher=The Sunday Times, http://sundaytimes.lk/|accessdate=23 January 2011}}</ref>
Since the successful overthrow of the Ben Ali regime, a number of self-immolation protests have taken place in other Arab republics. In [[Algeria]], [[Mohsen bouterfif|Mohsen Bouterfif]] set himself on fire after a meeting with a town mayor failed in helping him find employment and housing on January 13, 2011. He later died of his wounds. Also in Algeria, another man attempted but failed to burn himself.<ref>{{cite web|author=Ian Black Middle East editor |url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/2011/jan/16/tunisia-protests-suicide-algeria-arab |title=Tunisia's protests spark suicide in Algeria and fears through Arab world |publisher=Guardian |date= |accessdate=2011-01-23}}</ref> In [[Egypt]], Abdou Abdel-Moneim Jaafar, a 49-year-old restaurant owner, set himself alight in front of the [[Egyptian Parliament]].<ref name="Abdou Abdel-Moneim Jaafar">{{cite web|url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/1/2/4115/Egypt/Society/In-Egypt,-man-sets-himself-on-fire.aspx |title=In Egypt, man sets himself on fire, driven by economic woes |publisher=English.ahram.org.eg |date=2011-01-17 |accessdate=2011-01-23}}</ref> In [[Saudi Arabia]], an unidentified 65-year man died on January 21, 2011 after setting himself on fire in the town of [[Samtah]], [[Jizan]]. This was apparently the kingdom's first known case of self-immolation.<ref name="saudi">{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-12260465|title=Man dies after setting himself on fire in Saudi Arabia|author=|date=23 January 2011 |work=|publisher=BBC News, http://www.bbc.co.uk/|accessdate=23 January 2011 }}</ref><ref name="saudi2">{{cite web|url=http://sundaytimes.lk/world-news/4231-man-dies-in-possible-first-self-immolation-in-saudi|title=Man dies in possible first self-immolation in Saudi |author=Mohideen Mifthah |date=22 January 2011 |work=|publisher=The Sunday Times, http://sundaytimes.lk/|accessdate=23 January 2011}}</ref>
